commentary: Kulasekara to Chari, no run shooter in the first over. Full and outside off, Chari shimmies out and throws his hands at a drive. But the ball winks at him and cheekily sneaks under the bat. Naughty ball, and it shows the nature of the surface. It does not bounce at all

commentary: Lakmal to Chibhabha, 2 runs shot. Back of a length and outside off, stands up tall and punches it crisply between the covers and point. This could have been a boundary on any other outfield. This one is slow following the rains

commentary: Kulasekara to Chari, no run an appeal for lbw, umpire Rusere shakes his head. Back of a length and this one seams back in off the surface and ends on off, cramping the batsman for room, pinging the back thigh. It was definitely bouncing over the stumps

commentary: Kulasekara to Chari, FOUR runs Chari gets off the mark after 10 balls. Half-volley outside off, 130.8ks, the batsman feats on it, cracking a drive to the left of extra-cover, through the vacant cover-point region. Slow outfield or not, this one skips happily away to the fence

commentary: Kulasekara to Chibhabha, OUT umpire Rusere's finger goes up. This looks very adjacent, Kulasekara celebrates the wicket with a fast pump. Nice and full, swings back in a bit. Chibhabha is caught playing across the front pad and is trapped in front of middle. His head falls over too. It would have carried on to crash into middle and leg. Playing across the line is fraught with danger on these surfaces. Hitting leg, according to the tracker

commentary: de Silva to Chari, OUT Another chaotic mix-up, Chibhabha was the victim on Saturday. Chari is the victim here. There was never a run there. Never. Slid onto the leg stump from around the wicket, Chari dabs it a few feet to the right of short midwicket and scampers off. Ervine is not interested in chancing a single. Chari, however, is almost halfway down the pitch. He turns back, and dives desperately, but is caught miles short. Mendis ran across, grabbed the ball, and threw it flat to Dickwella, the keeper, who did the rest
text: Another chaotic mix-up, Chibhabha was the victim on Saturday. Chari is the victim here. There was never a run there. Never. Slid onto the leg stump from around the wicket, Chari dabs it a few feet to the right of short midwicket and scampers off. Ervine is not interested in chancing a single. Chari, however, is almost halfway down the pitch. He turns back, and dives desperately, but is caught miles short. Mendis ran across, grabbed the ball, and threw it flat to Dickwella, the keeper, who did the rest

commentary: Pathirana to Ervine, no run oh dear, another mix-up. Tossed on the leg stump, nudged to square leg. Mendis runs across to his left from short midwicket and throws it to the keeper, who does not collect the ball cleanly. He was too eager to swipe the bails off. Run-out chance missed. Ervine set off, Raza responded with a couple of steps before stopping. Ervine has to undo his steps, he pulls out a full-length dive, and is aided by the keeper's lapse
text: oh dear, another mix-up. Tossed on the leg stump, nudged to square leg. Mendis runs across to his left from short midwicket and throws it to the keeper, who does not collect the ball cleanly. He was too eager to swipe the bails off. Run-out chance missed. Ervine set off, Raza responded with a couple of steps before stopping. Ervine has to undo his steps, he pulls out a full-length dive, and is aided by the keeper's lapse
